bibl.title: Elements of Identification in Egypt 800 BC - AD 300.
Identifiers and Identification Methods in the Ancient World = Legal Documents in Ancient Societies. III

bibl.note: 1. Information about the individual [1.1. Name; - 1.2. Sex; - 1.3. Age; - 1.4. Physical description; - 1.5. Provenance (""race"", ""ethnic"") and residence (domicile); - 1.6. Title / Occupation / Profession]. - 2. Information about relatives and ancestors [2.1. Father's name; - 2.2. Mother's name; - 2.3. Paternal grandfather's name; - 2.4. Maternal grandfather's name; - 2.5. Further genealogical identifiers]. - 3. Non-verbal signs [3.1. Handwriting; - 3.2. Seals and stamps; - 3.3. Non-textual identity marks]. - 4. Official identification and the validity of documents.
bibl.seg: Mark Depauw, Elements of Identification in Egypt 800 BC - AD 300.

Mark Depauw & Sandra Coussement (edd.), Identifiers and Identification Methods in the Ancient World = Legal Documents in Ancient Societies. III = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 229 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 75-101.

1. Information about the individual [1.1. Name; - 1.2. Sex; - 1.3. Age; - 1.4. Physical description; - 1.5. Provenance (""race"", ""ethnic"") and residence (domicile); - 1.6. Title / Occupation / Profession]. - 2. Information about relatives and ancestors [2.1. Father's name; - 2.2. Mother's name; - 2.3. Paternal grandfather's name; - 2.4. Maternal grandfather's name; - 2.5. Further genealogical identifiers]. - 3. Non-verbal signs [3.1. Handwriting; - 3.2. Seals and stamps; - 3.3. Non-textual identity marks]. - 4. Official identification and the validity of documents.
